title.narrative: CN-Second Guangdong Pearl River Delta Urban Environment Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Project is to reduce water pollution in the Pearl River water system originating from Foshan and Jiangmen Municipalities through a package of key initiatives, including wastewater treatment and sludge disposal, water quality monitoring, sediment removal from waterways, and flood protection and river embankment improvement.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Cause Foshan to engage a consulting firm to provide required training and TA for institutional strengthening by December 31, 2007
FWGC & JBWC will prepare annually financial forecasts to review if it would meet the convenanted requirements and to furnish theresults of such review to the Bank & will take actions to meet covenant
FWGC and JBWC will generate total revenues to cover total operating expenses, increase in working capital, & will achieve a debtservice coverage ratio of 1.2 times in 2008 & 2009, & 1.3 times in 2010
Twelve months prior to commissioning the centralized sludge treatment facility to be construction in Nanzhuang, FWGC shall furnishto the Bank an analysis of the least cost solution

title.narrative: Evidence of improvement in effectiveness in operations, management and finances of wastewater utility services under the project

comment.narrative: (i) Unit Cash Operating Cost; Unit RMB/m3

title.narrative: Evidence of improvement in effectiveness: (iii) Consumption of electricity per unit
Evidence of improvement in effectiveness: (iv) Cost recovery ratio
Evidence of improvement in effectiveness: (v) Debt service ratio
Evidence of improvement in effectiveness: (ii) wastewater volume treated per employee
Reductions in pollution discharges entering the PRD river network from Jiangmen
Reductions in pollution discharges entering the PRD river network from Foshan

comment.narrative: Pollution load reduction load collected cumulatively WWTP operated since April 2010 till October 2013, ave annual COD removal is990 t/y, and NH4-N is 170 t/y.

title.narrative: Compliance rate for key indicators (COD, BOD, N and P) with river quality standards at measurement stations in Foshan

baseline.value: Foshan: COD 37 mg/l, BOD 6.3mg/l, NH4-N 4.22mg/l, TP 0.37mg/l

actual.value: COD 21.6 mg/l, BOD 3.2 mg/l, NH4-N 1.42 mg/l, TP 0.1 mg/l

title.narrative: Compliance rate for key indicators (COD, BOD, N and P) with river quality standards at measurement stations in Jiangmen

baseline.value: Jiangmen: COD 35 mg/l, BOD 9.5mg/l, NH4-N 1.8mg/l, TP 0.29mg/l

title.narrative: Volume (mass) of BOD pollution loads removed - Foshan

comment.narrative: BOD removal since April 2010 to Oct 2013 is 1952 tons.

title.narrative: Jiangmen Component:Increased % of wastewater collected and treated before discharge

comment.narrative: The total wastewater treated from Aug 2012 to Aug 2013 is 63.63 million m3, 174,300 m3/day or 87% of total capacity (200,000 m3/day)

title.narrative: Foshan Component:Increase in % of actual wastewater tariff to recommended cost recovery tariff

comment.narrative: Foshan just approve the 2-stage tariff adjustment plan to be implement in 2013-2014, aim at 100% cost recovery.

title.narrative: Jiangmen Component:Increase in % of actual wastewater tariff to recommended cost recovery tariff

comment.narrative: WW tariff is RMB 0.8/m3 as compared to the projection in PAD set at RMB 1.7/m3, 2013

title.narrative: Foshan Component: Increased % of wastewater collected and treated before discharge
Foshan Component:Evidence of satisfactory completion of works, as planned

actual.value: Substantially completed with minor works for completion in Apil 2014

comment.narrative: Construction of sludge treatment works was on track for completion in Dec 2013, all bidding of MIS were completed and is expectedto be complete in April 2014

title.narrative: Jiangmen Component:Evidence of satisfactory completion of works, as planned
Evidence of satisfaction: construction of interceptor sewers
Volume (mass) of BOD pollution loads removed - Jiangmen
Volume(mass) of BOD pollution load removed by treatment plant under the project
Evidence of satisfactory completion: Expansion of Wenchangsha WWTP
